|1 - ‚àë_{k=0}^m (f^{(k)}(0) / (k! * f(0))) z^k| ‚â§ C |z|^{m+1}.

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Complex Set Finset

/--
Suppose f is a holomorphic function on a neighborhood of the closed disk \overline{D}(0,1)
and suppose f(0) ‚â† 0. Then there exists a constant C such that for all m ‚àà ‚Ñï and |z| ‚â§ 1,

  |1 - ‚àë_{k=0}^m (f^{(k)}(0) / (k! * f(0))) z^k| ‚â§ C |z|^{m+1}.

This is stated here for f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ assuming there is an open set U with closedBall 0 1 ‚äÜ U
and that f is holomorphic on U.
-/
theorem holomorphic_taylor_remainder_disk (f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ) (U : Set ‚ÑÇ)
  (hU : closedBall (0 : ‚ÑÇ) 1 ‚äÜ U) (hf : IsHolomorphicOn f U) (hf0 : f 0 ‚â† 0) :
  ‚àÉ C : ‚Ñù, ‚àÄ (m : ‚Ñï) (z : ‚ÑÇ), |z| ‚â§ 1 ‚Üí
    |1 - ‚àë k in range (m + 1), (iterated_deriv ‚ÑÇ k f 0) / (‚Üë(Nat.factorial k) * f 0) * z ^ k| ‚â§ C * |z| ^ (m + 1) :=
by sorry
